headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: New Year's Eve Celebrations Across The World; Soon: UK, Portugal, Iceland, Ghana To Celebrate 2023; Tributes To Late Queen As Fireworks Welcome In 2023; CNN Latin America Marks New Year's With Long-Held Traditions; New Year's Eve Celebrations Across The World; London Welcomes 2023 With Return Of Firework Display; New York City Prepares For The Times Square New Year's Eve Celebration. Aired 7-8p ET

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Our Queen. It's just all over the world. The Queen is such a huge figure everywhere, not just the UK, but all across the world. So it was lovely to see people flock from all over the world come in memorial with that.

utterances.speaker: CHRISTINA MACFARLANE, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: The longest serving monarch in history. Guys, it is a pleasure to share this evening with you. We have minutes to go until the fireworks, so enjoy it. Happy New Year. And we will be right back after this quick break. Stay with us. New Year is coming.(COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: LYNDA KINKADE, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to our New Year's Eve Live special. I'm Lynda Kinkade and we are counting down to midnight in London, Ireland, Iceland, Portugal, Ghana and much of West Africa. It's great to have you with us. I want to go straight now to our Christina Macfarlane who is ready to see in the fireworks at the London Eye. We are just minutes away. Happy New Year, Chrissy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year to everyone on the river and around the world. We welcome you with an offer (ph) from around the world.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Farewell, Ma'am. And thank you for everything.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Lynda and Christina, cheers and best wishes from all of us on the national tour of Les Miserables. We are honored to celebrate with you and all of your viewers as we bring in the New Year together. Happy 24601.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Happy 2023.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to London where the New Year has just come to the United Kingdom and right on queue, so has the rain. Would you believe it, just moments ago, the fireworks were filling the sky around the London Eye behind me here, and were stinging and celebrating with it just before the rain came. Thousands are on hand here.I can see about, I don't know, we're reckoning 80,000 or 90,000 people here down the banks of the Thames ringing in the New Year's celebrations. My goodness, it was something we haven't seen before, I can say that much. An army of drones also accompanied the fireworks this year, wishing the crowd a very happy New Year. And with it, we heard the voice of our late Queen Elizabeth II ringing out over the airwaves here, as was the voice of King Charles. We also heard Ukraine mentioned during these fireworks celebrations. We heard the song Stefania by the band Kalush Orchestra. We knew Ukraine was going to be recognized as part of tonight's festivities. And it was pretty special to hear Stefania ringing out here live tonight on New Year's Eve. But let's now go to our Lynda Kinkade in Atlanta with a look and the further celebrations to come in the hours ahead. Lynda.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Christina, as you say, it's going to be hard top the celebrations there in London. Thanks so much to you. Well, the New Year is now heading to the Americas. In less than 3 hours, the clock strikes midnight in Argentina, Chile and parts of Brazil. The celebrations will undoubtedly be big in Rio, a place known for partying.Stefano Pozzebon is soaking up the atmosphere further south in the Brazilian city of Santos. Well, our friends, like you, Stefano, in Latin America, know how to party. Where is the best place to be this year?

utterances.speaker: POZZEBON
utterances.sentences: So, Lynda, I'm in Brazil, but you know, I live in Colombia. Here's my goal. You can bet in a few hours I'll set it on fire and hope for the best for 2023.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Well, wishing you all the best, you and your family. Stefano Pozzebon, Happy New Year. Thanks so much. We'll chat again very soon.Well, the lights are bright once more on Broadway. After the COVID pandemic forced the longest shutdown in history, there's now a full roster of shows on tap for theater loving fans. I spoke to the creative team behind the Neil Diamond musical a Beautiful Noise, one of the hottest new shows in town. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) KINKADE (voiceover): The life of one of the best-selling artists of all time. Now set on stage. UNIDENTIFIED MALE: 39 albums.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: 40 top 40 hits. The 120 million albums sold.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Neil Diamond was a kid from Brooklyn, New York, who had planned to enter medical school and steady entered the Music Hall of Fame. Tony nominee Will Swenson stars as the younger Neil Diamond.

utterances.speaker: WILL SWENSON, TONY AWARDS NOMINEE
utterances.sentences: I think the secret to doing this show is lots of sleep and lots of caffeine maybe.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Another Tony nominee, Mark Jacoby plays Diamond now.

utterances.speaker: MARK JACOBY, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: I'm still counting.KINKADE (on camera): So you play title roles in The Phantom of the Opera. The judge in Sweeney Todd, the Wizard in Wicked. What was it like when you heard that you had the role of Neil Diamond?

utterances.speaker: JACOBY
utterances.sentences: A bit overwhelming, frankly, because it's not just playing Neil Diamond the show is about Neil Diamond. It's his life. And in the case of our rehearsals here in New York, in front of that person, seven, eight feet away, but it's so hard not to be thinking about what does he think and how is he reacting to this? Does he hate me or does he love me? Or something in between?KINKADE (voiceover): Neil Diamond toured for nearly 50 years. But in 2018, he was forced to stop after being diagnosed with Parkinson's disease. In a note in the Playbill, he says, my heart and soul would tour until the day I die if only my body would cooperate. KINKADE (on camera): What input did Neil have in the show? Because I understand you went to his house with a draft of this musical.

utterances.speaker: ANTHONY MCCARTEN, WRITER
utterances.sentences: Yes, I was kind of misled. They said, just deliver it. When I got there, they invited me in and seated me down at this table and said, can you perform the entire musical for me? What? Here we go. At one, lights up and do the whole thing. It was kind of terrifying. But at the end he said, Get your producer on the telephone. So we called the producer and he spoke to the phone. Three words I'm a believer.KINKADE (voiceover): I'm a believer. Words from the hit song Neil Diamond wrote for The Monkees a clear endorsement. New Zealander Anthony McCarten, four time Academy award nominee is the show's writer. He's also the screenwriter behind the Winston Churchill drama "The Darkest Hour" and the Queen biopic "Bohemian Rhapsody." KINKADE (on camera): People go for the music, but they want a good story, right?

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Broadway was battered by COVID.KINKADE (on camera): For 18 months Broadway shutdown went dark. What impact did that have on you and other performers?

utterances.speaker: JACOBY
utterances.sentences: There was nothing, literally nothing in the way of live theater. So it was devastating. You know, I know so many people who left the business and without any intention of coming back.KINKADE (voiceover): The longest running show ever, the Phantom of the Opera, is set to close in April, 35 years after opening on Broadway because it was struggling to sell enough tickets to offset costs, attendance in January was the lowest it had been since 2003. Now the Broadway league says capacity is closer to 90 percent and shows like Tina are once more touring. KINKADE (on camera): Here on Broadway, theater goes is starting to return in large numbers after the longest shutdown in history. And things never seemed so good. So you're a local New Yorker.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I am a local New Yorker.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: What's it like having Broadway back close to full capacity?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's amazing. It was a really dark two years.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Sweet Caroline. Bump, bump, bump.KINKADE (voiceover): Remarkably, when the curtains rose on opening night, Neil Diamond willed his body to perform once more.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year to everyone in Times Square. And a toast now to our friends and colleagues at Warner Bros. 2023 officially marks their 100th birthday and what a milestone and a celebration of quality film and television. Well, let's take a minute now to look back at some of the greatest hits during the past 100 years. Happy Birthday.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year. I hope that 2023 is treating you well so far. I'm here with some of my friends and foes at Warner Brothers World Abu Dhabi. We wanted to let you know that Warner Brothers the legendary Hollywood studio that's the inspiration for our amazing theme park, is celebrating its 100th anniversary in 2023. And we're inviting everyone to join in on the fun. Here's a reel that highlights some of Warner Brothers. greatest hits. Enjoy. And happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: There is no place like Warner. There is no place like Warner. This is so amazing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What is it? The stuff that dreams are made of.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Are you ready?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm ready to fly.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We will do what is hard. We will achieve what is great.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I believe in hope. I believe in belief.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You can be anything you want to be.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You got to get me fired up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Here's Johnny.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It might else just getting goosebumps.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: CHRISTINE MACFARLANE, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: 2023 has arrived here in the UK and true to form, so has the rain right on time. The banks of the River Thames were lit up with fireworks just a few minutes ago. I was standing underneath this display and I can tell you it was extraordinary. It paid tribute for 12 minutes to our late Queen, King Charles, the war in Ukraine, the people of Ukraine, and, of course, to 50 years of pride here in London. Something we celebrated this summer. 12,000 fireworks just above my head here.But, you know, we're not the only ones. Portugal has just brought in their New Year. Here's a look at the fireworks on the island of Madeira. One of the biggest New Year's Eve parties in the world, of course, is taking place in New York City. I want to bring in CNN's Richard Quest, who is back with us now. I tell you, Richard, New York is going to have to come up with something pretty special top what I just saw here in London. RICHARD QUEST, CNN BUSINESS EDITOR-AT-LARGE: Please, this is Times Square. This is New York Central. This is where it happens since we last spoke. Take a look up there. You can see the ball. Well, it's sort of flashing now. It has now gone up to the top of the pole so that at 1 minute to midnight, it can start its journey down the pole and then will ring in the New Year. Typical, it is absolutely pissing (ph) it down. Here in New York. It is raining, but that has not stopped. Rahel.

utterances.speaker: RAHEL SOLOMON, CNN BUSINESS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: No. Hi.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Welcome.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: No, not yet. Rahel Solomon is with me here in. Now, is this your first time?

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: It is not so. So I have been a spectator once before a few years ago when I was in college. All I remember, Richard, is how cold it was. I was wearing a dress because again, I was in college. So young and dumb. Anyway, I promised and bowed I would never come back here again. And yet here I am, because I cannot miss a good party. So here I am.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: You said you wouldn't do it --

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: -- and you're doing it. You know, that's the definition of insanity. Doing the same thing. expecting a different result.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: I really like a good party. Where is the best party in the world? It is right here tonight. So here I am to enjoy and partake.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: All right, let's meet some people over here. Now, you are from --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: India. Bangalore.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Bangalore. Where it's about 20 degrees warmer and not as raining. Madam, much as beautifully attired, you're not very appropriately attired.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I know it's really cold in here, and it's raining really bad. I just hope it gets warmer and stops raining.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: It's a once in a lifetime trip, Richard, you know, I mean --

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: I've done it 20 odd times. You've done it twice.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Once in most people's lifetime. Also, we have some friends from Morocco.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Hello.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Hello.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Welcome.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Tell us about yourself.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So, I wasn't born in Morocco, but my whole family was. I'm the first one that was born in America.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Congratulations to the team --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you. I'm from France.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: -- in the World Cup.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Where you from?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'm from France.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: It's already been New Year. What time did you get here?

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: All right. We have some friends from Guatemala. We have some friends from Brazil. We've been making friends all night even in the rain. We have a friend from the US. Where are you from again?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm from Kansas City.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Kansas City, Missouri.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, Missouri. Go Chiefs.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: It's my whole knock card is based I only know that because I've been there a couple of times over the years. You're not dressed very appropriately.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm dressed warm --

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Richard, that's not very nice because we met this guy here because he was complimenting your attire.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, you're a tire of looking very dapper in the shoes.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: OK. Yes. But unfortunately, the shoes fell apart and are now being held together by Daffer tape. But you're looking rather splendid.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Well, I don't know about that. It's one of the trade secrets, right? It's all about what you look like from the waist up. And then what we're wearing on the bottom, no one really sees. So no one would normally see those boots.

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Well, happy to you. Whose cell phone is running out of power. Now you see, they've all planned.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Everybody still feeling good? Yes?

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: All right. Give us a Happy New Year, well, give us a cheer. I promise you, it does get louder. It does get more excited.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: You see better than this?

utterances.speaker: QUEST
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. We haven't even big guns. Christina.

utterances.speaker: JOE RUSSO, FILM DIRECTOR
utterances.sentences: Hi, Lynda and Christina. I'm Joe Russo.

utterances.speaker: ANTHONY RUSSO
utterances.sentences: Anthony Russo.

utterances.speaker: GIANCARLO ESPOSITO
utterances.sentences: Giancarlo Esposito.

utterances.speaker: STANLEY TUCCI
utterances.sentences: Stanley Tucci.J. RUSSO: And we are here working on our new movie, the Electric State, on location in Atlanta. Hopefully you'll be able to check out the movie in 2023 when it comes out. But we just wanted to say from all of us to all of you, have a happy, healthy, peaceful new year.

utterances.speaker: CROWD
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: LYNDA KINKADE, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Thanks there to the Russo brothers. And welcome back to our new year's special. I'm Lynda Kinkade, great to have you with us. Much of the world now has welcomed in 2023, the New Year was ushered in with the usual flare, featuring, of course, plenty of fireworks. Here are some of the highlights.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Welcome to 2023 Sydney, Australia.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: KRISTIE LU STOUT, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: An incredible sight here in Hong Kong. This is the first time I've seen fireworks over the Hong Kong harbor in almost three years. Wow, this really feels like a new beginning.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: WILL RIPLEY, CNN SENIOR INTERNATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Taiwan's reopening for the world after three years of pandemic. This is a democracy that is ready to showcase a positive message of peace on earth.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world with over 160 floors, with certainly one of the most saved. It's always ready to ring in the New Year.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: People are hugging, shouting Happy New Year, shoots in a car horn. There's a lot of hope. There's a lot of joy on the streets of Lagos tonight.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: That fireworks display at the (INAUDIBLE) has been absolutely spectacular.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Well, besides the parties and the fireworks, there is another New Year's tradition popping the question. Well for couples getting engaged tonight, we wish you congratulations. Our Christina Macfarlane is back now with a very personal story about New Year's proposals. Christina, your proposal did not go to plan.

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: That's right, Lynda. And as you can see, I am joined on stage here by a very special guest, CNN's Nick Paton Walsh, who our viewers may be familiar with as one of our intrepid foreign correspondent reporters. For me personally, though, I'm more familiar with him as being my husband and the father of our daughter, one year old Grace. Nick, Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: NICK PATON WALSH, CNN INTERNATIONAL SECURITY EDITOR
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year. Hello. I brought along this slightly menacing looking bottle of champagne.

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: OK, good. Let's not pop it just yet. I want to tell the viewers my story, which revolves around our proposal, my proposal to you on New Year's Eve. Now, Lynda, this happened in 2019. We were in Buenos Aires for weeks. I had been thinking about asking Nick to marry me on New Year's Eve. We've been building up to it all day, and then at about quarter to midnight, I thought, right, I'm just going to do it. So were drinking beers in Buenos Aires. I turned to Nick and I said, Nick, will you marry me? And you said, no. No.

utterances.speaker: WALSH
utterances.sentences: It was mango daiquiris, not beers.

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: Can we not please avoid the point? Nick said no. I was entirely crushed. And the reason, Nick, that you said no is because you said to me it is, and I quote, the man's job to propose. Yes, ladies, that is what he said to me. I'm sure it's something you're regretting now, Nick. It took you another, no, I'm not letting you speak. I'm not letting you speak. It took you --

utterances.speaker: WALSH
utterances.sentences: Perfectly. It's fantastic. Excellent news. You two are gang off me quite specially.

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: OK, well, the conclusion to the story is that it took you then another nine months to propose to me. Anyway, I will let you have your say.

utterances.speaker: WALSH
utterances.sentences: No. Nine months. Particularly biologically important period of time, but I just felt I needed to have some slight control with these very forceful anchor types. Once again, you know, ambush you at certain moments. And looking back, I think really yes, would have been the immediate first, best response. And as you can tell, I'm totally ambushed and flummoxed. And back to you. Thanks.

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: Nick, look at our viewers when you're speaking, please. No, look, it's absolutely fine. I understand the reasons why you did it, but I think the moral of the story here, Lynda, and to any of our viewers watching around the world whose girlfriends may have chosen the time to pop the question tonight. Gents, just say yes. We are living in the modern age after all, aren't we, Nick?

utterances.speaker: WALSH
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much. Yes.

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: OK. I know. I know. Well, look, I'm going to ask you again tonight in front of the London Eye and maybe 90,000 people. Nick Paton Walsh, will you marry me?

utterances.speaker: WALSH
utterances.sentences: Obviously a bit late now because we will be married for what?

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: We're married and we've got a baby. It's a bit late now, but maybe we should pop the champagne. Lynda, Nick can't hear anything you're saying, but I know you sympathize with me.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: I completely sympathize with you. But he was a bit slow off the mark, but I glad it only took him nine months. I do remember the plans for your wedding, Christina, which, of course, COVID played havoc with. I was very much looking forward to celebrate you two and style in the UK that didn't quite go to plan. I'm glad that you guys are happily married with a beautiful baby girl. Happy New Year.

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year to you, Lynda. And you never know, if we get around to it and we pull our finger out, we might still have those wedding celebrations sometime in 2023. But it has been absolute delight, Lynda, being live with you tonight from me and from Nick. Say Happy New Year to Lynda.

utterances.speaker: WALSH
utterances.sentences: Happy New Year, Lynda.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Welcome back. I'm Lynda Kinkade. I'm here with the Georgia Boy Choir. In recent years, they have toured the globe, performing in more than a dozen countries, including Italy, Estonia, China and Sweden. More recently, they performed in cities right across Iceland.Well, just in a moment, they will be performing the New Year's Eve classic Auld Lang Syne. But first, I spoke with a couple of the boys about their impressive international to it. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: What's the best thing about sharing the globe performing?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The best thing is like, sharing our music with everyone, and I like to see their faces and how they enjoy our music.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: What are you looking forward to most about going to Germany?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'd like to see all the views and singing for other people around the world.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: And what other country besides Germany are you going to?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We're going to England and we're going to go into England. We're going to go to many other cathedrals.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Have you guys performed in England or Germany before?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Already?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Wow. You guys travel a lot.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, we travel a lot. We've traveled many places.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Best place you've traveled to?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Iceland.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Iceland, as it was hard to beat. And what are you most looking forward to about 2023?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Germany and England. Definitely.

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Yes.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KINKADE
utterances.sentences: Absolutely special way to end our special News Eve broadcast. Our thanks to the Georgia Boy Choir there. I'm Lynda Kinkade in Atlanta, wishing all our family, friends and CNN viewers a very Happy New Year. It's been a pleasure hosting the show with you, Chrissy.

utterances.speaker: MACFARLANE
utterances.sentences: Lynda, it has been an absolute pleasure. I am Christina Macfarlane in London, and I tell you what, we are just getting started here on CNN New Year's Eve continues with Anderson Cooper and Andy Cohen from New York Times Square. That's coming up after this short break. A very Happy New Year to you all.(COMMERCIAL BREAK) (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
